info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 17 at 5:14AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...AN INTENSE BAND OF LAKE EFFECT SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF CENTRAL ERIE AND NORTHERN ERIE COUNTY... HAZARDS...A band of very heavy lake effect snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. This lake effect snow band is producing very heavy snow at the rate of 2 to 3 inches per hour in the heart of the band, with up to 4 inches per hour locally, especially closer to the lakeshore. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 515 AM EST, an intense band of lake effect snow was located from just north of Orchard Park to the city of Buffalo and extending inland to the Lancaster ,Cheektowaga, Clarence, and Williamsville areas. This band will continue to very slowly progress northward through the early morning hours and will be squarely across the Buffalo Metro area for the busy morning commute. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 49 and 56. SAFETY INFO... Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
